roleset.name: follow
roleset.note: TRACK-V NOTES: Member of Vncls chase-51.6, stalk-35.3. (from track.01-v)
TRACK-N NOTES: Based on verb entry track.01. Corresponds to Vncls chase-51.6, stalk-35.3. (from track.01-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: The Nasdaq bank index tracks thrift issues.

example.name: with instrument
example.text: The brokerage firm tracks technology stocks with its Technology Index.

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: The hunter's tracking the deer in the woods was halted by a sudden snowstorm.

example.name: Arg 0 & 1, within LVC
example.text: At one point , she gets so carried away with her thesis that she suggests that females were responsible not only for all of human evolutionary biology but for the very notion of counting in order *PRO* to keep track of menstruation.

example.name: Args 0, 1, 2
example.text: He continues his tracking of social media outreach for the Havana Central Restaurant chain.
example.arg: for the Havana Central Restaurant chain

example.name: Within LVC, with Arg3
example.text: You can keep track of time zones with this app.

roleset.name: be on track in relation to
roleset.note: TRACK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'track' based on survey of sentences in financial subcorpus and comparison with 'follow'. (from track.03-v predicate notes)

example.name: prepositional track
example.text: Indeed, the stock market's steady advance this year tracked with President Bush's success in advancing his capital-gain proposal.
example.arg: the stock market's steady advance this year
with President Bush's success in advancing his capital-gains proposal

example.name: Arg1,2
example.text: His progress's tracking with the expected milestones is entirely due to his determination and the hard work of his caregivers.

example.name: transitive, no benefactive
example.text: A Commonwealth Edison spokesman said that *trace* tracking down the two million customers whose addresses have changed during the past 3 1/2 years would be ``an administrative nightmare.''
example.arg: the two million customers whose addresses have changed during the past 3 1/2 years would be ``an administrative nightmare.''

example.name: Arg0,1,2
example.text: The reporter's tracking down the lone witness for his story made the piece much more compelling than it otherwise would have been.
